title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about racial injustice in the Deep South.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel that explores the dangers of totalitarianism.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A story about love, reputation, and class in early 19th century England.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A critique of the American Dream set in the 1920s.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A future society where humans are genetically engineered and conditioned.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: The quest of Ishmael to hunt the giant white whale, Moby Dick.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A sweeping narrative of Russian society during the Napoleonic Wars.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story about teenage alienation and loss.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic tale of the struggle between good and evil in Middle-earth.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical tale about pursuing one's dreams.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia
author: C.S. Lewis
description: A series of seven high fantasy novels set in the magical land of Narnia.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A novel about a future where books are banned and 'firemen' burn them.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A story about a man whose portrait ages while he remains young and beautiful.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A tale of morality and redemption centered on a poor ex-student in St. Petersburg.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: A comic science fiction series about intergalactic travel.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: A novel about the struggles of an Oklahoma family during the Great Depression.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A tragic love story set in Russian high society.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
description: A romantic drama about two teenagers who meet in a cancer support group.

title: Gone with the Wind
author: Margaret Mitchell
description: A story of love and loss set during the American Civil War.

title: The Bell Jar
author: Sylvia Plath
description: A semi-autobiographical novel about a young woman's mental breakdown.
